sentence.Network_en: In case anyone was following me, I made an elaborate detour.
sentence.Network_cn: 为了防止有人跟踪我，我特地绕了弯路。

sentence.Network_en: A radio-link automatically advises it of traffic snarls and plots a detour.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个无线电接入装置会自动通知交通拥堵状况，并给出绕行建议。

sentence.Network_en: They made a 3,000 mile detour simply to prove a point.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们绕行3,000英里只是为了证明自己能够做到。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent. (as a noun): from French détour 'change of direction', from détourner 'turn away'

entry.def: If you make a detour on a journey, you go by a route which is not the shortest way, because you want to avoid something such as a traffic jam, or because there is something you want to do on the way.

example.ex: He did not take the direct route to his home, but made a detour around the outskirts of the city.
example.tran: 他没有直接回家，而是绕到市郊兜了个圈子。

entry.def: A detour is a special route for traffic to follow when the normal route is blocked, for example because it is being repaired.
If you detour, you make a detour.

example.ex: On the way back, Jarvis detoured to check the time of services at the church.
example.tran: 回去的路上，贾维斯绕道去核实了一下教堂礼拜仪式的时间。

means.word_mean: 1. a roundabout road (especially one that is used temporarily while a main route is blocked)

auth_sentence.content: The Toad Detour has largely been embraced.

sentences.en: Signs directed traffic to a detour.
sentences.cn: 路标将来往车辆引向绕行的路。

sentences.en: We made a detour to avoid the heavy traffic.
sentences.cn: 我们绕道走, 避开繁忙的交通。

jushi.english: We made a detour to avoid the heavy traffic.
jushi.chinese: 我们绕道走，避开繁忙的交通。

jushi.english: Signs directed traffic to a detour.

jushi.english: We had to detour around the town centre so it took us a little longer to get here.
jushi.chinese: 我们不得不绕过市中心，所以多花了点时间。
